description:
Cover: Barry Mitchell (Judge Dredd)

  • Invasion - The Resistance (part 5 - final part) (Gerry Finley-Day - Sarompas)
  • Flesh - book one (part 5) (Studio Giolitti - Ramon Sola)
  • Harlem Heroes (part 5) (Tom Tully - Dave Gibbons)
  • Dan Dare - Hell Planet (part 5) (Kelvin Gosnell - Massimo Bellardinelli)
  • 2000AD Futuregraph - Red Alert! (art: Adrian D.Beeton)
  • M.A.C.H.1 - Probesnatch (Nick Allen - John Cooper)
  • Judge Dredd - Krong (Malcolm Shaw - Carlos Ezquerra)
name: Prog 5

description: Batman visits Killer Croc in Arkham Aslyum in hopes of learning new tricks. Meanwhile, memories of Thomas Elliot's tragic past begin to resurface and a romance between Batman and Catwoman blossoms!
name: Hush Chapter Three: The Beast (In the Mouth of Madness!)

description:
1. Cover by John Rosenberger and Vince Colletta.
  2. "The Mental Murder" written by Cary Bates, penciled by John Rosenberger and inked by Vince Colletta. (Lois Lane) What happens when a crime lord hires a psychic who tries to get Superman's secret identity?
  3. "Nightmare Alley!" written by Robert Kanigher, penciled and inked by Don Heck. (Rose and Thorn and the 100)
name: The Mental Murder / Nightmare Alley!

description:
Despite the preparations made by the Legion and Science Police forces, Robotica has successfully invaded Earth in a matter of minutes! To take the planet back, the Legionnaires head for a nearby world with centuries-dormant - but still lethal - warlike capabilities. But what - or whom - they find there is not to be believed! Then again, neither is the leader of Robotica, who finally meets Brainiac 5 face-to-face!

As the Robotica begins it´s assault on Earth, The Legio struggles to breach in it´s forcefield, what proves to be a difficult task, so they search for a big weapon (Pluto, the Warworld), while the Coluan people try to figure out how to go through the field; in Earth Brainiac is captured and Mr. Venge reveals himself to be Computo.
name: System Burn

description:
The Legion has found the one world that might have the weaponry necessary to defeat Robotica and retake Earth. Unfortunately, the only chance they have to use those weapons lies in defeating the legendary figures guarding them! Meanwhile, on Earth, Brainiac 5 matches wits with Robotica's leader, who Brainy is discovering is no slouch in the brains department either!

The Legion recruits Warworld to fight against Robotica and make plans to ultimately defeat it. They soon learn the true force behind Robotica is Computo, a former creation of Brainiac 5.
name: Choose Your Weapons

description:
In the tense minutes before the Legion's final clash with Robotica for the fate of the galaxy, we glimpse the thoughts, fears and aspirations of many of the individuals surrounding the Legionnaires and the United Planets. This is set against an eerie backdrop in which the Robotican leader's origins are revealed to Brainiac 5, and how those origins will forever alter the future!

As Brainiac 5 and Computo catch up (Grife, it has been quite a time since they last spoke to each other), The Legion struggles to breach Earth's forcefield with the help of Warworld and a whole brigade from the United Planets...meanwhile we witness the Coluan's plan to end the Robotica.
name: Meanwhile...

description:
It's the Legion's final battle with Robotica, as the race looks to evolve...and it looks like they have a Legionnaire on their side! Can the heroes convince their teammate's actions are in error...or will it be they who seal the fate of the human race by preventing the Robotican race's evolution?

Computo achieves his goal of evolution, which causes the war between organics and robots to end. Robots are now viewed as sentient beings.
name: Flesh Is Weak

description:
Welcome to Timber Wolf's first few days in the Legion fold! Relationships both personal and galactic are strained, one Legionnaire contemplates a leave of absence, a long-overdue memorial takes place, and Brin's first official mission goes awry - and not just because he's on the mission with a jealous husband and father in Ultra Boy! He sure could use some super-menaces to fight right about now...

Timber Wolf learns about his new life as a Legionnaire.
name: Legion Rookie Blues

description: Timber Wolf may as well be called by his new name, Lone Wolf, especially after his fellow Legionnaires are taken down by the Fatal Five! Battered and beaten, the odds don't look good for Brin Londo, but the Five are about to learn never to corner a wounded wolf!
name: Five Reasons To Call In Sick

description:
IT'S TIME AGAIN FOR TREEHOUSE TERROR! Prepare yourself to be scared silly by the monstrous talents of the comic industry, both young and old. Jim Mahfood (Grrl Scouts, Zombie Boy, and Clerks) guides Ned Flanders through the pits of Hell, when Rod and Todd are possessed by demons, turning Springfield upside down. C. Scott Morse (Soulwind, Visitations, and Volcanic Revolver) paints the town red with a tale of a beast, a bar, and the redemptive power of beer. Peter Kuper (Eye of the Beholder, The System, and MAD's Spy Vs. Spy) goes Kafka on Homer Simpson, when he metamophisizes him into a cockroach. And finally, Veteran Archie artist and pin-up pioneer Dan DeCarlo and Bongo's own Bill Morrison take "weird" science into their own hands, play God, and create a modern Prometheus in a story of adolescence, acne, and re-animation, we call "Young Frinkenstein." Scream with delight as Bongo dishes out a helpful heaping of Halloween horror!

Chapter Titles

  1. Hell-O-Ween (Jim Mahfood & Ian Boothby / Jim Mahfood) - What happens when Rod and Todd are possessed by demons?

  2. Metamorphsimpsons (Peter Kuper) - Kafka's metamorphosis, Simpson style, with Homer as the bug.

  3. Young Frinkenstein (Bill Morrison / Dan DeCarlo & Allen Roberts) - Bart is turned into a young Frankenstein by the Professor.

  4. From Duffs Till Dawn (Scott Morse) - What happens when Professor Frink's blood sucking creature gets Barney?

  5. Terrifying and Tantalizing Tales of Trick-Or-Treating! (artists have Halloween recollections)

  6. Martin's Folktales From Around the World (Stan Sakai) - A folktale of the sparrow and the two boxes.
name: Hell-O-Ween; Metamorphsimpsons; Young Frinkenstein; From Duffs Till Dawn

person_credits.name: Bill Morrison
person_credits.role: writer, editor, artist, penciler, inker, colorist, cover

description: Tom Judge return to hell, and meets train conductor, who is a actually God.
Judge goes to hell to settle old score with a murderer.
The universe unfolds, revealing layer upon layer of intrigue. As Tom Judge takes the pilgrimage of a fallen soul, he follows in the footsteps of Dante only to realize that they don't go very far.

Sensor's life is in the hands of a villain, as the Legion turns to Ra's al Ghul to save her. But her hours may be numbered as Ra's has escaped into the labyrinthine vastness of Legion World! It all sets the stage for "Dream Crime" - the explosive 5-part story beginning next month! 

Ra's Al Ghul attempts to escape Legion World and nearly succeeds, but reveals that he made the attempt to only show the Legion that he could escape, demanding respect. He then saves the life of Sensor, even though her body has been transformed dramatically.
name: Revival Of The Fittest: Part Two

description: Tom Judge goes to hell and sends Jackie Estacado back to earth.

"Revival of the Fittest," Part 1 of 2. M'onel is escorting the dormant body of Ra's Al Ghul to a secure facility when he receives word that Sensor has suffered life-threatening injuries. Ra's has the genius and skill to save her...but will awakening him also mean awakening the evil that lies within?

The Legion requests the assistance of an imprisoned Ra's Al Ghul to to save the life of Sensor.
name: Revival Of The Fittest: Part One

description: Devil sends Tom on an errand to save hell's stock market.
Mr. Black sends his troops to kill Tilly and Tom.
A battle between heaven and hell, and Tom Judge in the middle.
Mr. Black finalizes his plan, and takes his ensured place in hell. Judge stops his rule and saves the day.

name: Avril Lavigne's Girlfriend: Sleight of Hand and Heart

volume.name: Avril Lavigne's Girlfriend: Sleight of Hand and Heart

description: Cerebus and Jaka continue their talk. Cerebus wants to head north to live in the wilderness: just the two of them. Jaka can't move north because she's pregnant. Bran announces of the conquering of the Red Marches.
name: Terrible Analogies

description: Reference to the Universe X series.
The Avengers and Freedom Force join forces to stop a prisoner revolt in the maximum security prison the Vault led by the evil Venom. continued in Venom: Deathtrap
name: GN

description:
Introducing a new art team and kicking off "Dream Crime," a new 5-part storyline! Saturn Girl visits Titan, hoping to repair the damage to her mental powers, and Dreamer hopes the Titanet telepathic system will turn her powers of prediction into a large-scale early-warning network for the United Planets. But Saturn Girl learns the damage to her mind might be more extensive than she believed, and Dreamer's first experiments with the Titanet show her terrible visions of an ancient darkness rising once more.

Saturn Girl and Dreamer go to Titan, where Saturn Girl can relax and Dreamer can implement her precognitive abilities into the Titanet. While there, Dreamer gets a precognitive flash of doom for all the citizens of Titan as well as an image of Darkseid.
name: Dream Crime: Part One

description: Bugs and Daffy owe some money to Rocky and Mugsy, so they try their hand at being stage magicians! Viva Las Vegas!
Yosemite Sam and Daffy both want all the goldmines to themselves! But for that, they must ask the Goldfather a favor and show a little respect.

1. What's Wrong With These Pictures? (public service message / written by Jack Schiff)

  2. The Game of Secret Identities Part I (Superman and Batman / written by Edmond Hamilton)

Can Batman and Superman give each other amnesia so they can discover each other's secret identity?

  1. Super Turtle (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff)

  2. The Game of Secret Identities Part II: The Super Detective

  3. The Congorilla of Space (Congorilla / written by Robert Bernstein : reprinted from: Adventure Comics #276)

Congorilla goes to another planet an meets a purple alien Congorilla.
name: The Game of Secret Identities

description: Doc Seismic escapes form Jail, and captures all of earth's superheroes including Wolf-Man, Savage Dragon, and even the entire Capes corporation have been captured, and taken underground. During this time Invincible is in Africa trying to talk to Atom Eve about their little incident a few days back when Cecil pages Mark. He tells Mark whats happening and Eve, and Invincible go to help out. When they reach the underground layer Atom Eve, and Invincible are bombarded with monsters. Eve is caught off guard and knocked out. Wolf Man tries to help out yet is knocked out as well. Invincible fights off the monsters one after the other when he reaches Doc Seismic he is so exhausted that he falls to the floor. Doc Seismic yells out,"I WIN!"
name: Invincible

description:
1. Cover by Curt Swan and Stan Kaye.
  2. "The Boy in the Bottle!" (Jimmy Olsen, Superman, Lucy Lane, Van Zee, Lyle / written by Jerry Siegel : Reprinted: in Superman #187. Jimmy gets stuck in Kandor because the exchange ray broke...
  3. Moolah the Mystic (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff)
  4. "The Giant Turtle Man!" (Jimmy, Superman, Lois Lane, Lori Lemaris / written by Jerry Siegel)A giant turtle Jimmy is under a criminal's control, see the cover for what happens... Reprinted in Superman's Pal Jimmy Olsen #104.
  5. Cora the Car Hop (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff)
  6. "The Black Magician" (Jimmy, Superman, Lois, Lucy, Perry White)Instead of turning Jimmy into a were-wolf like last issue, Mxy sends Jimmy back to Arthurian times to get Lucy Lane. Jimmy meets Arthur and Merlin. In this story, Merlin is a 5th dimensional imp, like Mr. Mxyzptlk! Can Jimmy beat both these foes?
  7. Parents Have Rights, Too! (public service message / written by Jack Schiff)
name: The Giant Turtle Man!

description:
1. Duell I Solen (Tom and Jerry)

  2. Barney Bear and Benny Burro story

  3. Stadens Skrack (starring Droopy)
name: Duell I Solen

description:
The 5-part "Dream Crime" storyline heats up! Saturn Girl awakens from the events of last issue to find that her life has been a hoax. The Legion still is lost in the Kwai galaxy, Live Wire still is alive, and the team still is trying desperately to save Element Lad! Saturn Girl must figure out why someone has gone to the trouble of making these last few months seem so real.

Saturn Girl is under the thrall of the hypnotism power of Universo.
name: Dream Crime: Part Two
Tarzan and the Fires of Tohr

volume.name: G.I. Joe: A Real American Hero

description:
1. Free Speech -- Free for All! (public service message by Buzzy / written by Jack Schiff)

  2. The War Against Superboy! Part 1: The Battle of the Robots! (Superboy, Ma and Pa Kent, Superboy Robots / all parts written by Jerry Siegel : all parts reprinted in: Superboy #138)

The Brain (no, not that Brain) and the General start a war vs Superboy. They destroy his robots...

  1. Let's Go Hunting! (puzzle and activity page)

  2. The War Against Superboy! Part 2: The Battle of Krypto! (Superboy, Krypto, Bizarro-Krypto, Ma and Pa Kent)

... now they use Bizarro Krypto against Krypto! ...

  1. Little Pete (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff)

  2. The War Against Superboy! Part 3: The Battle of Superboy! (Superboy, Ma and Pa Kent, Kryptonite)

... now they use Kryptonite against him!

  1. Peg (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff)
name: The War Against Superboy!

volume.name: G.I. Joe: A Real American Hero

description:
"Dream Crime," Part 3 of 5. The Legion squares up for combat with the forces of Apokolips while two members, Shikari and Sensor, unravel clues that could reveal the secret of the Dream Crime as well as the whereabouts of two lost Legion members.

Sensor and Shikari are forced to flee the Legion after they are hypnotized by Universo.
name: Dream Crime: Part Three

description:
1. The Alaskan Adventure (written by Otto Binder)

  2. The Trumpet of Doom (written by Bill Woolfolk)

  3. The World's Mightiest Mistake

  4. In Mexico

"Dream Crime" Part 4 of 5, featuring the return of a pair of lost Legionnaires! Evil has gained control of the entire United Planets, and Dreamer is down! Who's left to help? Hold on tight for the return of Karate Kid and Ferro!

Shikari and Sensor are able to recruit Karate Kid and Ferro to battle against Universo. They are seemingly defeated in their endeavor.
name: Dream Crime: Part Four

volume.name: G.I. Joe: A Real American Hero

description:
The secret behind "Dream Crime" is revealed in the senses-shattering conclusion to this 5-part storyline! The heroes of the 31st century find themselves faced with the most comprehensive, stealthiest conquest of civilization ever undertaken, plus a menace who exists only in their minds.

The Legion defeats the threat of Universo.
name: Dream Crime: Part Five
Rolling Thunder

volume.name: G.I. Joe: A Real American Hero
G.I. Joe: A Real American Hero

name: Who's the Hero

volume.name: G.I. Joe: A Real American Hero
G.I. Joe: A Real American Hero

description: The Joe's travel to Sierra Gordo to rescue Dr. Adele Burkhart for a second time. They find some help with the local natives the Tucaro Indians. Elsewhere, Storm Shadow begins to train Cobra Commander's son Billy as a ninja.
name: Walk Through the Jungle

volume.name: G.I. Joe: A Real American Hero
G.I. Joe: A Real American Hero

description:
Legendary Legion artist Steve Lightle returns for an issue spotlighting the team's darkest member: Umbra! On extended leave from the Legion, Umbra heads home to see if her birth world holds any clues to the disappearance of her powers. But things have changed on Talok VIII, and the darkness that was once her friend is now her enemy.

A depowered Umbra returns to her home planet of Talok VIII. She finds the planet covered in shadow and learns that her distant cousin, Grev, has taken control of the shadow power. She fights him and gains her abilities back.
name: After Dark

description:
A jam-packed special outlining the former, current, and future class of X-Men! In a yearbook format, Xavier’s Institute is outlined by its students and their favorite extracurricular activities. A must-read for any X-fan!

Beast narrates. A Yearbook of the various Xavier Institute classes.
name: Yearbook

description:
The High Evolutionary has decided to take away mutants' powers.

Reprints:

"What Dreams May Come..."

Uncanny X-Men #379

"Heaven's Shadow"

Uncanny X-Men #380

"Oh, The Humanity!"

X-Men #99
name: What Dreams May Come... / Heaven's Shadow / Oh, The Humanity!

description:
Kicking off the landmark 6-part story "Foundations" that brings Superboy into the Legion! Part 1 kicks off in Smallville, where a young Clark Kent is confronted by three oddly dressed teens...but by the end, a dead hero will have returned, a young man will have found his destiny, and an apocalyptic darkness prophesied in "Dream Crime" will have reared its ugly head!

The Legion celebrates Foundation Day, the day the Legion was created. To honor that day, the Legion sets up the Legion Cadets, promising individuals who train to join the Legion.
name: Foundations

description:
Overview

Supergirl thought she triumphed over Reactron, but the radioactive madman has one last trick up his deadly sleeve. Supergirl plunges into a world where up is down, and no, we're not talking about Bizarro World!

When Supergirl saves a terminal boy, she tells him he'll be alright now. The child takes this as he is not going to die within weeks. Supergirl visits him in the hospital to set things right. At the last moment, she tells him that he is going to live and she won't let him die. Everyone in the room, including Superman freezes as a man in armor appears and shoots at Kara. She catches the bullet only to find that it is made out of Kryptonite.

Weakened, Kara doesn't know what to do, who this man is or why everyone but them is frozen. She thinks that Batman would be able to think of a way out of this as the man points the gun to her head.

Slowly Superman's eyes begin to glow red and a beam of heat vision burns the man's hand through his suit. They begin to shimmer and are teleported into the future.

The machine that was used to bring here there was destroyed and the man that kidnapped her is the only one that can fix it. He is marked for death but Supergirl flies him out of there to get answers. He tells here that because of her, they are no longer humans. The man ingests poison that will kill him and prevent Supergirl from returning to her time to save the boy.

Supergirl flies the man back to where the machine is so he can fix it before he dies. They find the machine has already been repaired. The man is saddened by the appearance of the Batmen.

One of the Batmen approaches Kara and tells her it's "been a while." She asks if he's Bruce and he replies, "Sort of." They send her back to her time. The dying man begs her not to save the boy. She asks one of the Batmen what she should do. He tells her to forget the man and to say hello to Clark.
name: The Girl Of Tomorrow

description:
Special Christmas-themed Dredd tale this issue, plus the final part of the current Invasion story 'The Prince'.

Cover: Kevin O'Neill (Judge Dredd)

  • Judge Dredd - Red Christmas (John Wagner - Mike McMahon)
  • Invasion - The Prince (part 8 - final part) (Gerry Finley-Day - Mike Dorey)

Very first issue to feature the '2000AD credit card' which actually shows who scripted, illustrated and lettered the stories in the comic.

The Harlem Heroes return in a new story and a new future sport - Inferno.

Supercover 18: Kill Those Slimy Aliens! (Lopez)

  • Inferno (part 1) (Tom Tully - Massimo Belardinelli)
  • Invasion - Jump Jet (Chris Lowder - Ian Kennedy)

Supercover 14: The Silver Cyborg (Trevor Goring)

description:
After spending six months as Judge Marshall on Luna-1, Dredd returns to Mega-City One this prog.

description:
"Foundations" continues with part 2 of 6 as THE LEGION ships biweekly! As Superboy and the revived Live Wire try to assimilate to all that has happened to them, the Legion finds itself battling Darkseid's servants. Meanwhile, Dreamer attempts to investigate the various time anomalies, but if her power fails.there is no future!

Superboy has somehow traveled to the future and joins the Legion. They are surprisingly attacked by foes that appear to be from Apokolips, the home of Darkseid.
name: Foundations, Part Two

description: Navigators and explorers are a special breed — they blaze the paths others will follow. They must have strength, drive, and hope, and be more than a little fearless. But nowhere is it written that they must have luck. Gav and Jori Daragon make their living charting the routes of hyperspace and selling those routes to traders and haulers. When a starswarm cluster batters their ship, they land on the planet Cinnagar, destitute and forlorn, and convince the relatively amiable Aarrba the Hutt to make the necessary repairs.
name: Into The Unknown

volume.name: Star Wars: Tales of the Jedi - The Golden Age of the Sith

description:
Overview

“CHALLENGE OF THE OVER-USED MUSE,” Part Two

After Scud is hired by Heaven to destroy the world, he and Drywall attack VOO-DOO BEN’S office at Scudco. Deep inside the robot factory, Scud’s monster primary target, JEFF, waits for revenge. Scud 22 climaxes with a battle royal between Scud, Drywall, V.D. Ben, Jeff and three dozen disposable assassins.
name: The Challenge of the Over-Used Muse

description: A news reporter gets a tour of the Legion and learns about every member and their functions.

"Foundations," Part 3 of 6. Superboy makes his first public appearance as religious fervor ramps up and Worshippers of Darkness attack the Church of the Last Son. Plus, Brainiac discovers the apocalyptic secret behind Darkseid's bravura scheme.

The Legion makes plans to deal with the impending arrival of Darkseid.
name: Foundations, Part Three

description:
What are Mark Grayson's powers? What is his origin? Who is he? Where did he come from? This BARGAIN-PRICED zero issue answers all those questions and more. An excellent jumping-on point for new readers, this primer issue brings new readers up to speed while laying down the groundwork for upcoming storylines. It's a MUST-HAVE for current and future readers of INVINCIBLE.

In issue 22, Mark Reveals to Amber that he is Invincible and not cheating on her or a drug dealer. In issue 0; Mark elaborates on his secret life. He explains his origin from start to finish--when he received his powers to when he fought his dad (Omni-Man). Telling Amer the story is still very difficult for Mark but it ends up bring him and Amber closer; which becomes very obvious in the end of the issue.

Note: this issue takes place between Invincible issues 22 and 23.

Jeph Loeb & Jim Lee continue their run on BATMAN with Part 4 of "Hush." Fun in Metropolis! Catwoman and Batman journey to the City of Tomorrow to track down Poison Ivy. This capricious couple thinks it has the upper hand but soon finds Ivy has something - or someone - up her sleeve. And keep your eyes peeled for a mysterious flying hero whose deeds inspired a young Bruce Wayne.
name: Hush Chapter Four: The City  (Welcome to the Jungle!)

description:
Bongo's reign of terror continues to cause conniptions with this year's riotous recipe for halfbaked horror: Start with a pinch of "bloody good" black humor courtesy of Garth Ennis (Preacher, Hitman) and John McCrea (Hitman, Jenny Sparks, Monarchy), add a dash of Victorian suspense by Troy Nixey (Jenny Finn, Batman: The Doom That Came to Gotham), sprinkle it with the wonderful wizardry of Stan Sakai (Usagi Yojimbo), and top it off with a "bizarro" tale by Gotham's greatest villain and the rebel alliance's greatest hero, Mark Hamill. And if that is not enough to satisfy you, how about a deliciously delirious backcover by Dan Brereton (The Nocturnals)?

Chapter Titles

  1. In Springfield No-One Can Hear You Scream (Garth Ennis / John McCrea) - Bart sees an Itchy and Scratchy cartoon based on the movie "Alien." Later he dreams Springfield gets invaded. Is it a dream?

  2. I'm Not In Springfield Anymore! (Stan Sakai) - Wizard of Oz Simpsons style, with Lisa as Dorothy. (Try and think who fils the other roles)

  3. Homererectus (Troy Nixey) - Homer becomes a "primitive man" display. You'll have to guess when where and by who!

  4. Catastrophe In Substitute Springfields! (Mark Hamill / Bill Morrison, Jason Ho, & Mike Rote) - Professor Frink makes flawed Homer clones, if that's possible!

  5. Fearless Fables And Fictions (Not For The Faint- Hearted) (Artists share Halloween stories)

  6. Destroy All Simpsons (Godzilla-esque pin-up by Dan Brereton on the back cover)
name: In Springfield No-One Can Hear You Scream; I'm Not In Springfield Anymore; Homererectus; Catastrophe In Substitute Springfields

person_credits.name: Bill Morrison
person_credits.role: editor, artist, penciler, inker, colorist, cover

description: Weisshaupt tells Cerebus where there are two more aardvarks. He also asks Cerebus for absolution, but Cerebus doesn't give it to him, and leaves him alone near death, something Bishop Powers wanted Weisshaupt to succumb to.
name: Varying Reasons of Assorted Depths

description: Daffy's having an art attack! He must be the best painter of all, no matter what Bugs Bunny paints up.
Sylvester and Tweety go on a camping trip with Granny. Unfortunately, the locals aren't the most welcoming folks.

1. Cover by Bob Oksner.
  2. "Superman Marry Me" written by Cary Bates, penciled by John Rosenberger and inked by Vince Colletta. (Lois Lane, Superman, Perry White) Lois Lane is needed to testify against a gangster. But then she hallucinates about having a giant invisible son named Mic. Can she remain credible?
  3. "The Superwoman of Metropolis!" Reprinted from Superman's Girl Friend Lois Lane #8.
name: Superman Marry Me / The Superwoman of Metropolis!

description:
1. Happy Hobby Time (public service message by Superboy / written by Jack Schiff)

  2. Duel of the Super-Gamblers Part I: The Super- Gamble With Doom

  3. Duel of the Super-Gamblers Part II (Superman and Batman / written by Edmond Hamilton)

Batman checks in on some supposed crooked gambling establishments, run by aliens. Batman loses a bet and is transported to an alien planet. Superman goes there too to rescue Batman. Now the stakes are raised to Batman's life!

  1. The One-Ape Circus (Congorilla / written by Robert Bernstein : reprinted from: Action Comics #259 )

Congorilla gets kidnapped to perform in a circus

  1. Honey In Hollywood
name: Duel of the Super-Gamblers

description:
Oliver, Invincible's step brother, receives a new tutor. Robot introduces his new body (cloned from Rex Splode) to the Guardians of the Globe. Invincible visits Art, and discusses his girl problems between Atom Eve and Amber. During this time Amber gets a number from a guy named Gary who attends her school. Invincible changes the subject to talk about his father, and about the peculiar words he told him after he was taken away by Viltrumites, "read my books!". Art gives Invincible copies of his books and Mark is shocked all of these books are about space adventures, and the things that can hurt Viltrumites. Mark comes to a startling conclusion that through these books his dad is telling him how to beat the Viltrumites.

Features a Capes backup story.

Overview

Stories are "War on the Sioux Trail" art by Joe Certa and John Belfi from Durango Kid #9 Feb/Mar 1951, "The Man Who Lost Yesterday",art by Frank Bolle from Tim Holt #37 Aug/Sept 1953, "Book of Doom" (Ghost Rider)art by Dick Ayers from Best of the West #7,Mar 1953, "Texas Killer" art by Dick Giordano and Vince Alascia Rocky Lane Western #71, Mar 1956
name: War on the Sioux Trail

description:
Mark Grayson is just like most everyone else his age, except for the fact that his father is the most powerful superhero on the planet. And now he's begun to inherit his father's powers. It all sounds okay at first, but how do you follow in your father's footsteps when you know you will never live up to his standards? "Perfect Strangers," Part Three, The status quo becomes a thing of the past when Mark's world is torn apart before his eyes. How will he pick up the pieces? Events in this issue lead into our big issue 12 spectacular! Don't miss it!

Omni Man tells Mark the true story of Viltrum, and how they are an evil race who help the people who decide to be ruled by their empire and kill the people who don't. He explains that he was only on earth to someday enslave it, and although he had made friends and found love, and for a time he was happy he knew it would have to change. He even admits that he didn't love Deborah Grayson. Mark tries to deny the whole thing, and tells him that he doesn't give a damn about Viltrum, and he will not enslave his friends and family. Omni Man tries to calm him down, and tell him that he does not know what he is saying. Mark tells him he knows what he's saying and they begin to fight!
name: Perfect Strangers (Part 3)

description:
In July of 1999, Dark Horse began to publish creator-owned material under the Maverick imprint. In order to celebrate their first year, seven highly creative artist/writers were asked to submit whatever they wanted for this superb anthology collection.

“Mercy” by Frank Miller is a tender story of compassion and justice. Paul Chadwick gives us a new Concrete story with “Family Night.” “Ancient Joe” has a way with women in C. Scott Moore’s brief story of remembrance. Stan Sakai treats us to a charming two-page travelogue of his trip to “Norway!” “It’s About Time!” is a beautiful Body Bags tale by Jason Pearson while Brian Ralph gives us a look at what happens when you “Dig Deep.” Dylan Horrocks finishes up the book with a haunting story of “Western Wind.”
